channel.title: News - South China Morning Post
channel.description: All the latest breaking news from Hong Kong, China and around the world

item.title: China can help bridge divide with the West by offering to mediate between Russia and Ukraine
item.description: The hostility between China and the West could be seen in terms of Beijing being cast as a member to the out-group. By mediating in the current conflict, China would show that it is truly on the same page as the West in wanting peace.
item.dc:creator: Winston Fung
item.author: Winston Fung

item.title: Japan and UK agree on defence pact amid China’s rise in Indo-Pacific
item.description: ‘Ukraine may be tomorrow’s East Asia,’ warns PM Fumio Kishida after talks with British counterpart Boris Johnson in London.
item.dc:creator: Kyodo
item.author: Kyodo

item.title: The crackdown on China’s ‘moderate’ rights voices: how tweets are now landing people in prison
item.description: A number of activists are facing years-long jail sentences for online posts and organising private gatherings, activities that would have usually attracted a reprimand in the past.
item.dc:creator: Guo Rui
item.author: Guo Rui

item.title: Russian oligarch’s yacht seized in Fiji on US request
item.description: US Justice Department said Fijian authorities served a search warrant freezing the yacht, which earlier was prevented from leaving the South Pacific nation. American officials say the 348-foot vessel belongs to Suleiman Kerimov.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.author: Associated Press

item.title: Could a small device give oxygen to China’s human moon base ambitions?
item.description: Using lunar soil as a catalyst, scientists hope to test a life-support system for astronauts in space.
item.dc:creator: Holly Chik
item.author: Holly Chik

item.title: US Fed rate hike: how can China stem capital outflow and prop up the yuan?
item.description: As the US central bank announces its sharpest rate increase in 22 years to address decades-high inflation, analysts speculate on how Beijing will try to soften the economic blow.
item.dc:creator: Frank Tang
item.author: Frank Tang

item.title: Jimmy Lai: Prosecutors could amass more evidence against jailed media tycoon after liquidators drop bid for return of 2.8 million files seized by police
item.description: By surrendering the files to police, liquidators of his Next Digital firm could end up giving prosecutors additional evidence.
item.dc:creator: Brian Wong
item.author: Brian Wong

item.title: Hong Kong district official among 5 suspects detained in police operation against prostitution syndicate
item.description: Administrative officer arrested for allegedly helping gang to book hotel rooms for sex workers and their clients.
item.dc:creator: Clifford Lo
item.author: Clifford Lo

item.title: Covid killed nearly 15 million people in two years, WHO excess deaths data shows
item.description: Toll nearly 10 times higher than official count for India, whereas China data does not offer new insight.
item.dc:creator: Josephine Ma
item.author: Josephine Ma

item.title: SoftBank wins key corporate battle in China by ousting defiant CEO from Arm joint venture
item.description: Arm China has registered Liu Renchen, a deputy dean at Tsinghua University’s postgraduate school in Shenzhen, as its new legal representative, paving the way for SoftBank to proceed with IPO plans for UK-based chip designer Arm.
item.dc:creator: Che Pan
item.author: Che Pan

item.title: Coronavirus Hong Kong: inability of patients to list chronic medical conditions undermines care and could lead to death, experts say
item.description: Issue comes to light after a 59-year-old man with multiple chronic illnesses was sent to isolation facility and died.
item.dc:creator: Victor Ting
item.author: Victor Ting

item.title: Britain’s Queen Elizabeth to miss royal garden parties
item.description: The 96-year-old monarch, who has mobility issues, has missed a number of events this year but has been carrying out virtual engagements and her other duties
item.dc:creator: Agencies
item.author: Agencies

item.title: ‘Japan is a buy’ Prime Minister Fumio Kishida tells City of London before meeting with UK’s Boris Johnson
item.description: The Japanese Prime Minister said his country’s economy would see robust growth as it shifts to an upgraded form of capitalism, in which public and private sectors work together.
item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.author: Reuters

item.title: Coronavirus: WHO estimates Covid-19 pandemic killed nearly 15 million people in 2020-21, more than double official figures
item.description: The WHO estimates 15 million people were killed either by the coronavirus or by its impact on overwhelmed health systems the past two years, more than double the official death toll of 6 million.
item.dc:creator: Agence France-Presse
item.author: Agence France-Presse

item.title: Hong Kong chief executive election 2022: John Lee vows to make reopening borders a priority for city to remain competitive
item.description: Goal is to remove obstacles to satisfy the requirements for reopening even though there will be ‘lots of challenges’, Lee says.
item.dc:creator: Tony Cheung
item.author: Tony Cheung

item.title: Chinese ex-journalist jailed for insulting Korean war ‘martyrs’
item.description: Luo Changping was also ordered to make a public apology for saying soldiers depicted in a blockbuster movie were ‘stupid’.
item.dc:creator: Phoebe Zhang
item.author: Phoebe Zhang

item.title: Japanese warship, jets shadow PLA Navy strike group on western Pacific combat drills
item.description: PLA Navy carrier strike group carries out battle exercises south of Okinawa and east of Taiwan, closely monitored by Japan
item.dc:creator: Liu Zhen
item.author: Liu Zhen

item.title: Singapore archbishop ‘dismayed’, ‘ashamed’ as Catholic Church parishioner jailed for sex acts with teenage boys
item.description: Archbishop William Goh apologises on behalf of the Church after a ‘prominent’ man in Singapore’s Catholic community pleads guilty to two charges and is jailed for five years.
item.dc:creator: Kok Xinghui
item.author: Kok Xinghui

item.title: Stop playing the Taiwan card, China tells US ahead of landmark White House speech
item.description: Chinese foreign ministry says relations are at a crossroads and now is the time to avoid confrontation.
item.dc:creator: Shi Jiangtao
item.author: Shi Jiangtao

item.title: UK voters go to polls in elections that could prove historic in Northern Ireland and heap further pressure on Prime Minister Boris Johnson
item.description: Poor results could reignite simmering discontent for Boris Johnson within his ruling Conservatives about his leadership, after a string of recent scandals, while Belfast could see a pro-Irish nationalist party win for the first time.
item.dc:creator: Agencies
item.author: Agencies

item.title: ‘Drop passwords altogether’ to improve online security, expert says
item.description: One expert said passwords are ‘becoming increasingly insecure’ and ‘easily hacked’, and adopting other forms of log-in such as multi-factor authentication is better.
item.dc:creator: dpa
item.author: dpa

item.title: Coronavirus: Why do people in South Korea still wear masks even after law mandating them was lifted
item.description: Some experts believe one of the reasons why some South Koreans are choosing to keep their masks on is to get some relief in a society obsessed with looks. It also shows respect for other people’s well-being.
item.dc:creator: Business Insider
item.author: Business Insider

item.title: Hong Kong student jailed 14 months for carrying petrol bombs near police station
item.description: Magistrate dismisses argument that the arrest was an attempt to make the student a scapegoat for attacks on police station.
item.dc:creator: Brian Wong
item.author: Brian Wong

item.title: Shanghai children’s study finds shorter Covid-19 fever, fewer symptoms
item.description: Fudan University hospital researchers also say asymptomatic children may have contributed to the city’s widespread transmission.
item.dc:creator: Zhuang Pinghui
item.author: Zhuang Pinghui

item.title: China’s ‘miracle’ survivor pulled from rubble of illegally built 6- storey building more than 88 hours after disaster
item.description: A young woman’s miraculous survival in a collapsed building has stunned China after she pulled through for several days in the ruins of the illegally built structure, but 50 people remain missing.
item.dc:creator: Alice Yan
item.author: Alice Yan

item.title: New China policies to support Big Tech platforms in innovation, globalisation, official newspaper says
item.description: News of the policies aligns with political messaging in Beijing that the months-long tech sector crackdowns, which have wiped about US$2 trillion from related stocks, would start to ease.
item.dc:creator: Tracy Qu
item.author: Tracy Qu

item.title: Covid-19 in China: Chengdu FISU World University Games to be postponed for second time, sources say
item.description: The event, originally due to take place last year, had already been put back to late June.
item.dc:creator: Chan Kin-wa,William Zheng,Finbarr Bermingham,Phoebe Zhang
item.author: Chan Kin-wa,William Zheng,Finbarr Bermingham,Phoebe Zhang

item.title: Hong Kong police make first arrests under law banning sale of e-cigarettes, 2 suspects remain in custody
item.description: Two suspects, aged 28 and 31, are being held on suspicion of selling electronic cigarettes after police raided a mobile retail outlet in Mong Kok.
item.dc:creator: Christy Leung
item.author: Christy Leung

item.title: South Korean minister weighs in on BTS military service amid ‘rich-poor’ debate
item.description: A survey conducted last month found a majority of Koreans support an alternative to compulsory military service for BTS. Some opponents say it just highlights preferential treatment for the wealthy, powerful and connected.
item.dc:creator: Park Chan-kyong
item.author: Park Chan-kyong

item.title: Ukraine war: fighting blocks evacuation of civilians pinned down in Mariupol steel plant
item.description: Ukrainian officials believe around 200 civilians remain trapped along with fighters in a sprawling network of underground bunkers at the Azovstal steel works plant.
item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.author: Reuters

item.title: Why Taiwan’s legal status has sparked fresh row among rival political camps as Japan treaty remembered
item.description: Former president Ma Ying-jeou says it is absurd for ruling Democratic Progressive Party to deny legitimacy of own administration.
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Chung
item.author: Lawrence Chung

item.title: China travel, tourism ‘unlikely to improve materially’ as coronavirus curbs hit Labour Day holiday
item.description: Trips taken during China’s Labour Day holiday fell by a third compared with the same period last year, with over 300 million people in 43 Chinese cities under full or partial lockdowns to contain the spread of the latest coronavirus outbreaks.
item.dc:creator: Luna Sun
item.author: Luna Sun

item.title: Coronavirus Hong Kong: more than 6,000 workers at isolation facilities ‘to become jobless’ as outbreak eases
item.description: Labour sector lawmaker Dennis Leung says health authorities plan to wind down operations at six community isolation facilities as early as next Thursday.
item.dc:creator: Fiona Sun,Nadia Lam
item.author: Fiona Sun,Nadia Lam

item.title: Myanmar junta court rejects Aung San Suu Kyi corruption appeal
item.description: The Nobel laureate is expected to challenge the latest decision in a higher court, as she faces a raft of other trials, including for allegedly violating the official secrets act, several counts of corruption and electoral fraud.
item.dc:creator: Agence France-Presse
item.author: Agence France-Presse

item.title: Hong Kong police arrest 7 after dozens of victims are cheated in scams involving bogus low-interest loans
item.description: The suspects, six men and a woman, aged 20 to 38, were holders of bank accounts that were used to collect the proceeds of crime, police said.
item.dc:creator: Clifford Lo
item.author: Clifford Lo

item.title: Indian policeman arrested for raping teen sex assault victim
item.description: The officer assaulted the 13-year-old girl who went to his police station in Uttar Pradesh to report she had been gang-raped by four boys.
item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.author: Reuters

item.title: Why May 9 ‘Victory Day’ in Russia is different this year
item.description: This year’s Victory Day won’t just honour a conflict that ended 77 years ago. Many Russians will be thinking about the thousands of troops fighting in neighbouring Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.author: Associated Press

item.title: Arriving in Hong Kong and unsure about city’s vaccine pass scheme? Here’s what you need to know
item.description: From Thursday, all those entering the city will be issued with a ‘provisional vaccine pass’ QR code together with a compulsory quarantine order at border checkpoints.
item.dc:creator: Danny Mok
item.author: Danny Mok

item.title: China’s zero-Covid rules, Ukraine war creating ‘severe challenges’ for European businesses
item.description: Some 23 per cent of European companies are considering shifting current or planned investments out of China due to Covid-19 controls, a new survey shows, while the Ukraine war is adding to supply chain woes.
item.dc:creator: Orange Wang,Wendy Wu
item.author: Orange Wang,Wendy Wu

item.title: Chinese capital issues work from home orders to stem Covid-19 outbreak
item.description: Dozens of subway stations closed in Beijing to try to stop surge in Omicron numbers.
item.dc:creator: Jane Cai
item.author: Jane Cai

item.title: US-China tech war: surveillance camera maker Hikvision hopes for ‘fair’ treatment as US reportedly weighs harsh sanctions
item.description: Hikvision, which provides surveillance cameras used in China’s Xinjiang region, said it hopes to be ‘treated fairly’ if the US decides to add it to a new sanctions list that could impair its ability to do business globally.
item.dc:creator: Zhou Xin,Yaling Jiang
item.author: Zhou Xin,Yaling Jiang

item.title: Hong Kong’s ESF school group to offer its 18,000 pupils a HK$1,600 relief grant after earlier revealing plans to raise fees
item.description: English Schools Foundation tells parents in a letter that it will offer the grant to students amid the ‘challenging times’ of the Covid-19 pandemic.
item.dc:creator: William Yiu
item.author: William Yiu

item.title: Why Russia is attacking Ukraine’s railway system
item.description: Russia has moved to obstruct the flow of Western weapons to Ukraine by bombarding rail stations and other supply-line targets across the country.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.author: Associated Press

item.title: How Hong Kong’s role as a foreign investment gateway to China will be solidified
item.description: Although China has been strengthening its intellectual property laws, weak enforcement remains a concern, especially for foreign firms. A recent bill on reciprocal recognition and enforcement of judgments in civil and commercial matters between Hong Kong and the mainland puts the city in a unique position.
item.dc:creator: Bernard Chan
item.author: Bernard Chan

item.title: Fraudsters swindle more than HK$132 million from victims as online investment scams in Hong Kong jump
item.description: Scammers posing as investment experts usually prey on targets through social media and sometimes deploy good-looking and sweet-talking con artists to lure victims.
item.dc:creator: Clifford Lo
item.author: Clifford Lo

item.title: North Korea blasts South’s new leader Yoon Suk-yeol, calls his minister picks ‘pro-US toadies’
item.description: A propaganda website criticised Yoon for stirring up confrontational madness trumpeting a ‘stronger South Korea-US alliance’.
item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.author: Reuters

item.title: Ukraine war: Russian billionaire Vladimir Potanin dodges politics and sanctions to flourish
item.description: ‘Nickel King’ Vladimir Potanin has moved fast to take advantage of opportunities thrown up by hurried asset sales since Russia invaded Ukraine on February 24.
item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.author: Reuters

item.title: China’s Communist Youth League the latest state-backed group to embrace NFTs, with tokens marking its centennial
item.description: To mark its centennial and Youth Day, China’s Communist Youth League issued 54,000 NFTs for free, labelling them digital collectibles as is common practice in China where cryptocurrencies are banned.
item.dc:creator: Coco Feng
item.author: Coco Feng

item.title: US Sikorsky anti-submarine helicopters ‘too expensive for Taiwan’
item.description: Island was going to purchase 12 of the aircraft but defence minister says the price is too high.
item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.author: Reuters

item.title: US disputes report its intelligence helped Ukraine kill Russian generals
item.description: Citing multiple senior US officials, The New York Times said that of the approximately dozen Russian generals killed by Ukrainian forces, ‘many’ had been targeted with the help of US intelligence.
item.dc:creator: Agence France-Presse
item.author: Agence France-Presse
